name: Carbon Footprint Champions
title: Highest Carbon Emissions Per Capita
description: In 2023, Palau recorded the highest greenhouse gas emissions per capita globally, with a staggering 84.71 t CO2e per person. Carbon dioxide emissions alone accounted for 81.21 t CO2e per capita.

name: Tourism Titans
title: Tourism Dominates Export Economy
description: In 2017, international tourism receipts made up 93.52% of Palau's total exports, highlighting the country's heavy reliance on tourism as a primary economic driver.

name: Carbon-Intensive Economy
title: High Carbon Intensity of GDP
description: Palau's carbon intensity of GDP was among the highest in 2023, with 6.56 kg CO2e per constant 2015 US$ and 5.14 kg CO2e per 2021 PPP $ of GDP, indicating a significant environmental impact relative to economic output.

name: Eco-Friendly Champs
title: Leading in Methane Emission Reduction
description: Palau has achieved a remarkable reduction in methane emissions, decreasing by 77.44% from 1990 levels as of 2023. This positions the country as a leader in environmental sustainability.

name: Small but Mighty
title: Efficient Government Spending
description: In 2022, Palau's general government final consumption expenditure was $92,886,700, showcasing efficient use of resources for public services.

name: Trade Trailblazers
title: Modest Merchandise Exports
description: With merchandise exports valued at $2,000,000 in 2023, Palau demonstrates a modest yet growing presence in global trade.

name: Education Enthusiasts
title: Low Female Unemployment with Advanced Education
description: In 2020, only 0.417% of females with advanced education were unemployed, highlighting Palau's effective integration of educated women into the workforce.

name: Fiscal Challenges
title: Significant Current Account Deficit
description: Palau faced a current account deficit of 52.99% of GDP in 2022, indicating challenges in balancing international trade and financial flows.

name: Revenue Riddles
title: Limited Revenue Generation
description: In 2020, Palau's revenue excluding grants was 62,717,000 LCU, suggesting constraints in domestic revenue generation.
